page.title: 17Housing
page.content: In the area there is a mixture of old and new houses. Most of the old ones are built out of stone with tiled roof. Some new bungalows are now being built. To make way for these,an old brick shed near the school was pulled down. Most ofthem are of different design. The{Rectory}was built of stone in 1860 and trees are growing tall around it. Another stone house built in 1740 is in use still. In 1830 {Waddingham Old School }was built.It is 155 years old.The school has not been used since 1983 because snow was blown under the tiled roof and the suspended ceiling fell in. {Rusling's Shop}is about 90 years old.It is built of stone but has fairly modern windows.Most of the schoolchildren buy their sweets there. { }
